reviews.review_msg: Best instructor in FIC so far
Really great person and teacher
Her lectures are very clear!

Amazing math prof! Her explanation videos were easy to follow, and if you still didn't understand she always saves time in class for questions, provided lots of additional resources to help you learn, and most of her lessons are spent working through examples to help you learn. Try to get her for MATH 100 and/or 151!!
She is an amazing professor. The lectures are clear, well-organized, and easy to follow. She is always patient and ready to help with any questions.

She is one of the best profs of Maths. She has great lectures and if you attend attentively, you will grasp everything easily and wouldn't need outside help. She even solves every doubt in class and even the midterm papers and quizzes. She gave out printed notes and materials to help even more. She is the best, don't think twice.
10/10 recommended. Although there were quizzes every week, but it's very easy and a great chance for you to revise for the lessons, so you guys wont be struggling that much in mid terms or finals ;D
Recommend if you are in FIC first or second term. One of the best teacher in my life!!!
Better read from book. unhelpful.

Math100 is a very basic math course for Year 1 student. Each class you have a small quiz, I guarantee that you will get at least 80%  if you listen while shes teaching. The two midterm and final exams are easy as long as you know all the knowledge in MATH100. A very lovely teacher and she is always willing to help.
An awesome teacher, made me fall in love with math. A 100% recommended teacher. Easy credits in math. Very understable lectures.

Nadia teaches good. I have taken this course as a IS1 course. So , it was really very fast and lots of work to do every week .We had to do 60-70 questions in 2 days and she selects 4 questions to grade from the whole 60-70questions . The quizzes are easy if we listen to the classes and revise all topics.I used textbook just to complete the homework

The professor gave lots of homework. Each class assignment will have at least 50 to 70 problems that you have to work on in the textbook. In addition, there are 10 additional questions in a single PDF. There are only about 2 days to finish it. Worst of all, she only chooses four questions in your homework to determine your grades.
She is very good at teaching, very polite and friendly. As due to pandemic FIC is conducting online classes that's why lectures are pre recorded.

she is the best teacher, she always has 3 office hours a week. Her assignment, quiz, and exam were easy as well. You just need to practice on her homework and focus on the lecture slide and then you will be fine. She very nice when you ask questions and mark easy
Ver accessible regardless of online classes, if you follow her lectures and visit her office hours you will get a good grade on this course.

The best math teacher I have had in a long time. Her online class lectures were clear and explained things in detail and she was available for office hours three times a week which is more then any other proffs. Super helpful and nice during office hours and knows how to explain things to get you to figure it out yourself without making you sweat.
She has the Best online class Structure! very caring and organized! You will love her if you take her as your instructor! You have to work hard to get a good grade thought!
Worst prof ever! Blabbers on.
The quizzes are always easy, and the exam is not that hard as well. Her handwriting is really nice, and she will hand out the material for each class, so it's no need to print it by yourself.
Nice handouts that help me study efficiently before the exams, fair difficulty in the exam. Amazing explanation in math problems.
She is really great for math151. She give good lectures and handouts.
Awesome teacher. Take her cause she is great

Nadia is an amazing professor, she cares about your process and her class, The class would be hard if you don't have a good math background but she is really good explaining and her lectures are interesting. Above all the instructors giving math in FIC I would pick her without a doubt.
she does not explain she assume you know all the necessary content to solve the respective excercise. for me was the worst class ever

Nadia is an amazing professor, she gives good feedbacks and her office hours are very important. She also gives you tips to manage her subject with other courses. You need to be consistent in her classes. Her midterms are slightly challenging but if you do homework properly, its gonna be fine. Her final exams are also the usual.
she teaches the class clearly and never get angry when the student ask her questions. She also gives grade easily

Nadia's lectures are fun. If your phone rings during lecture, you'll be asked to bring timbits next week. She's my favorite instructor of this sem. I struggled a lot at the beginning as Nadia taught super quick but doing tb questions really helped. The average of each midterm is around 50-60% so is this a gpa booster course? I wouldn't say so.
Those who blame her are not really doing their homework carefully.

Nadia is so sweet! I like her rule ( if someone's phone rings in the class, then this person will take snacks to all classmates next class.) for snack, just kidding:) The quizzes, midterms and final are not too hard. just do homework and think.

Kind. Her notes and exam sheets are important. Clears confusions. Always helps others in problems if they call her.  Gives tips on how to do well in mid-term and final exams. Would love to be in her class again (Unfortunately, she's unavailable for next 8 months). Would also recommend others students to enrol in her class. And those lovely cookies.

Amazing professor. Excellent at teaching and clarifying doubts. NOTE she will not be taking summer and fall 2017 and will only return in winter 2018 PS: COOKIES ;D (people who have taken her courses will understand)
Amazing Teacher

Do your homework regularly, and some of the questions from the textbook appear again in the quizzes and midterms. The midterms are graded quite fairly, but I got 0 for 1 question in which I only got one line of the graph wrong. Anyways, she is easy with all the tests, study her notes well and you will get high grades easily. Highly recommended.
She is patient for all of the questions. Sometimes she makes me confused, but thats not her fault because the cource is difficult.

Well as the name shows, she is Persian. Nadia was one of the best teachers I've ever had. Amazing lectures ; she does not make you confused. On the other hand, she is ready to explain a problem to you as many as you want. Quizzes and midterms are just like the home works, however doing homework is not mandatory, but it's better for you to do them.
The papers don't come from her class work, all form the textbook , which you gotta study on your own.
Very nice.
Nadia is a really nice instructor. I can tell that she loves math and she provides lecture notes each week to help students study. She also explains materials well!
I do like this prof,she is really a nice people,whos helpful,caredul and care about her students.take her class,u wont regret!

It seems previous years may have had it more difficult than others. The exams were really compose of everything from the notes and text (nothing you haven't seen before). Doing all those really gives you no reason to fail. She has a really sweet personality, which makes up for these dreaded 8:30 classes.

This is the easiest class you could ever take. I honestly cannot grasp the 40% fail rate. The exam and quizzes are examples from the lecture or questions from the homework. All you have to do is check your work over and you should get an easy A in a Q course at that. (this is from a history student who needed a q-course)

Nadia as a person is very kind, and very passionate about math. Assignments from the book are easy, lon capa requires only basic understanding, quizzes are from assignments, but the midterms combine the toughest concepts and questions. That was frustrating for me, to have never applied those concepts together before.

she is a really good prof! one of the best! she really cares about you and her exams questions are similar to lecture,lon capa and assignment questions! she is really sweet!i adore her!however the course needs a lot of hard work doing questions

Easy, cute, funny, sweet, kind, enthusiastic, awesome. Best prof I had this semester. Goes over examples, encourages questions and will always help you out if you need the help. Goes out of her way to help you out. Easy midterms/final. Class was not curved though. I want her for MATH 155. T.T
She's difficult. Nuff said.
Great teacher always willing to help. A real straight shooter doesn't waste your time in class and really tries to get in as much as possible. Pretty hot, especially for a math teacher

Really liked the lady.. if she sees you in the hallway, she will recognize you, and smile! However, the exam/midterms do not reflect what has been taught in class and what is in the book! The final really had nothing to do with the book!

Very clear when teaching. Will aptly answer questions in class. Goes at a good pace and will adjust if class is struggling. Accent is super cute and she always says "good morning!" which was nice for a 8:30am class. Work hard and very possible to get a good mark.

Solid good prof. Very accessible and friendly when approached for help, whether after class or at workshop. Notes can be a bit deceiving, as in class examples WAY easier than what she will test you on. Trick is to not rely on notes but do hardest questions in book.

lectures rarely provide any additional insight beyond what is in the textbook. In fact, the explanations in the book are usually much more clear. Exams do not reflect what she covers in class at all, and are usually quite tricky.
One of the worst profs I've ever had. She is hard to understand and very disorgainized. I found her notes unhelpful as well as her explinations. Do not take this class if she's teaching it!
Clear and straightforward. Hot as well!
Best teacher ever! Midterm/final exams questions = lecture note questions/homework problems but the numbers are changed. Easiest a I have ever earned!

hated math, LOVED this prof! has such a sweet attitude and gives clear and concise notes. her tests are also freakishly easy and exactly like hw assignments. no curveballs whatsoever. wish she taught calculus
She's cool

VERY disorganized lectures. She often does not do what is on the course notes, and adds random bits and piece. and more importantly, DOES NOT HAVE LECTURE RECORDINGS. This professor lives in the freaking stone age, she doesn't use a projector either.
Her tests are insanely hard despite the other raters. Midterms are nothing like what you learn in class.
Easy course but everything can be learned on your own using the textbook. If you study her notes and review instead of the textbook you will do poorly on the midterm.

She's very nice and helpful. Very clear too considering her accent.Gives several examples to make it easier to understand the lesson. Smiles a lot, which shows that she isn't the cold, cranky and unsocial professor stereotype.

Great professor. Goes the extra mile to help her students. Very clear in her lectures and notes. Exams are fairly easy. She really cares for her students and tries to make sure everyone does well. Highly recommend taking her as a professor. Overall a very nice person. Take math 100 with her.

Provides lecture notes that is easy to follow. The test are more than fair very easy. She is a very helpful prof because she explains materials very clearly and shows you the easiest and hard method for solving questions.

She is a very good math professor. She provides lecture notes which you can follow during her explanations and she is very clear explaining the reasonings and methods for solving questions. Her test are more than fair, its easy.
